intro: Cyphostemma horombense, commonly known as the Horombé cyphostema, is a climbing plant native to Central Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. Its fruit is a fleshy, red berry that contains several seeds. Cyphostemma horombense is often found in forest understories and is adapted to humid, tropical climates.
